title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, January 18, 1869
summary: Scott expresses satisfaction over the arrival of a new teacher, Margaret Burke. He also applauds the efforts of other teachers in Staunton, but comments that he is frustrated with local blacks, saying that the "colored people are so crotchety here there is no telling how long they will permit Northern Societies to labor for them." [Scott misdates this letter]
keywords: African Americans, Education, Women, American Civil War
